page.title: 12Brinklow's Transport
page.content: North of this block the{Fosse Way crosses another Roman road,the{Watling {Street}(A5) at High Cross and carries traffic to the M1 and M6. Before the{Oxford Canal}was straightened there was a village dock yard for boat building and heavy goods.A boat hire business is still at Stretton_under_Fosse.In the past, folk travelled by foot or carriers cart.Now most families run their own car or travel by public transport. Coaches can be hired from a local garage.Contract coaches carry local children to Middle and Secondary schools.Brinklow once had its own station for the London to Birmingham railway,but today people must use the stations of Coventry and Rugby.Within easy reach are the airports at Coventry and Birmingham enabling locals to travel to foreign parts.
